member.name: P:SmartBear.TestLeft.TestObjects.Web.WebElementPattern.ObjectLabel
member.summary: The label or text of the sought-for object. Check this value in the TestLeft UI Spy panel before setting it in your test. By default, TestLeft searches for the exact match. To mark variable parts, use wildcards (* or ?) or specify regular expressions (regexp:...).
member.remarks:
The property value depends on the web element type:ElementProperty Value
Button objectsThe button's caption.
Fieldset objectsThe text of the child Legend object.
ASP.NET controls and Sencha ExtJS objectsThe object's native property that specifies the label or placeholder text.
Other web elementsThe label element associated with the sought-for element.

member.name: P:SmartBear.TestLeft.TestObjects.Web.WebElementPattern.contentText
member.summary: The text the sought-for object contains (including the text of child elements). By default, TestLeft searches for the exact match. To mark variable parts, use wildcards (* or ?) or specify regular expressions (regexp:...).
member.remarks:
The resulting string contains the combined text contents of the object and of all of its child objects. This text includes visible elements as well as hidden ones, that is, the elements with style.display="none" or style.visibility="hidden".
TestLeft generates the contentText property value in the following way:
The test engine analyzes the cell's DOM child nodes and finds all text nodes among them (that is, nodes with nodeName equal to #text).
For each text node, TestLeft gets the node's nodeValue property, trims whitespaces at the beginning and at the end of the value and replaces subsequent spaces, tabs, non-breaking spaces and line breaks with a single space.
Adds a line feed character to the end each value.

member.summary: Overrides the method.

member.summary: Pauses the test execution until the web page is downloaded. The page loading timeout is specified by the TestLeft.Options.WebTesting.PageLoadTimeout value (the default value is 1 minute).
member.returns: The URL of the page or resource that was loaded last on the page. If the web page does not contain frames and the page was loaded successfully, the Wait method returns the page's URL. If the page contains frames, the method returns the URL of the page that was last loaded in a frame. If the loading was not successful or the page had not finished loading before the timeout elapsed, the method returns an empty string.
member.exception: Will be thrown if invocation fails.
Will be thrown if there are network problems.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.TestObjects.Web.IWebPage.Wait(System.Int32)
member.summary: Pauses the test execution until the web page is downloaded, or until the specified timeout elapses.
member.param: The time (in milliseconds) to wait until the browser loads the page.
member.returns: The URL of the page or resource that was loaded last on the page. If the web page does not contain frames and the page was loaded successfully, the Wait method returns the page's URL. If the page contains frames, the method returns the URL of the page that was last loaded in the frame. If the loading was not successful or the page had not finished loading before the WaitTime timeout elapsed, the method returns an empty string.
member.exception: Will be thrown if invocation fails.
Will be thrown if there are network problems.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.ApplicationManager.Run(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Runs the specified application and returns its process object.

Command-line arguments for the application.
The path to the working folder of the application.
member.returns: The object that corresponds to the launched application instance.
member.exception: Thrown if there are network problems.
Thrown if the application could not be run.
Thrown if an earlier version of the test engine (TestComplete/TestExecute) is used.

The user name (in the format Domain\UserName) to be used to run the application.
The user's password.
Command-line arguments for the application.
The path to the working folder of the application.
member.returns: The object that corresponds to the launched application instance.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.ApplicationManager.RunBrowser(SmartBear.TestLeft.BrowserInfo,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Launches a web browser and, if a URL is specified, navigates to the web page.
member.remarks: Once the URL is specified, the method pauses execution until the browser loads the page and becomes ready to accept user input or until the certain timeout is reached. The default timeout value is 60000 ms, however it can be changed via the IDriver.Options.WebTesting.PageLoadTimeout option.
member.param: The object that specifies the browser to run. Use the TestLeft.IDriver.Applications.Browsers property to get a list of BrowserInfo objects for all installed browsers. To learn more, see Run a Web Browser in TestLeft documentation.
The URL of the web page the web browser will open.
Command-line arguments for the browser.
member.returns: The object that corresponds to the launched browser instance.
member.exception: Thrown if there are network problems.
Thrown if the application cannot be launched.
Thrown if an earlier version of the test engine (TestComplete/TestExecute) is used.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.ApplicationManager.RunBrowser(SmartBear.TestLeft.BrowserInfo,System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Launches a web browser and, if a URL is specified, navigates to the web page.
The method pauses execution until the browser loads the page and becomes ready to accept user input or until the specified timeout is reached.
member.param: The object that specifies the browser to run. Use the TestLeft.IDriver.Applications.Browsers property to get a list of BrowserInfo objects for all installed browsers. To learn more, see Run a Web Browser in TestLeft documentation.
The URL of the web page the web browser will open.
The time (in milliseconds) to wait until the browser loads the page and becomes ready to accept user input.
Command-line arguments for the browser.
member.returns: The object that corresponds to the launched browser instance.
member.exception: Thrown if there are network problems.
Thrown if the application cannot be launched.
Thrown if an earlier version of the test engine (TestComplete/TestExecute) is used.

member.remarks: Once the URL is specified, the method pauses execution until the browser loads the page and becomes ready to accept user input or until the certain timeout is reached. The default timeout value is 60000 ms, however it can be changed via the IDriver.Options.WebTesting.PageLoadTimeout option.
member.param: The browser's family name.
The browser bitness - 32-bit, 64-bit or any.
The URL of the web page to open in the browser.
Command-line arguments for the browser.

member.exception: Thrown if there are network problems.
Thrown if the application cannot be launched.

The method pauses execution until the browser loads the page and becomes ready to accept user input or until the specified timeout is reached.

The browser bitness - 32-bit, 64-bit or any.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.ApplicationManager.RunBrowser(SmartBear.TestLeft.BrowserType,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Launches a web browser and, if a URL is specified, navigates to the web page.
member.remarks:
Once the URL is specified, the method pauses execution until the browser loads the page and becomes ready to accept user input or until the certain timeout is reached. The default timeout value is 60000 ms, however it can be changed via the IDriver.Options.WebTesting.PageLoadTimeout option.
If you have both 32- and 64-bit versions of a browser installed (for example, 32-bit and 64-bit editions of Internet Explorer on a 64-bit version of Windows), TestLeft will launch the 32-bit version of the browser.
member.param: The browser's family name.
The URL of the web page to open in the browser.
Command-line arguments for the browser.
member.returns: The object that corresponds to the launched browser instance.
member.exception: Thrown if there are network problems.
Thrown if the application cannot be launched.
Thrown if an earlier version of the test engine (TestComplete/TestExecute) is used.

member.summary:
Launches a web browser and, if a URL is specified, navigates to the web page.
The method pauses execution until the browser loads the page and becomes ready to accept user input or until the specified timeout is reached.

remarks.para: If you have both 32- and 64-bit versions of a browser installed (for example, 32-bit and 64-bit editions of Internet Explorer on a 64-bit version of Windows), TestLeft will launch the 32-bit version of the browser.

member.param: The browser's family name.
The URL of the web page to open in the browser.
The time (in milliseconds) to wait until the browser loads the page and becomes ready to accept user input.
Command-line arguments for the browser.
member.returns: The object that corresponds to the launched browser instance.

Thrown if the application cannot be launched.
Thrown if an earlier version of the test engine (TestComplete/TestExecute) is used.

member.name: T:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.MSAASettings
member.summary: Manages the list of window types that are identified via the MSAA engine.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.MSAASettings.AddWindow(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a window type to the list of MSAA window types.
member.param:
A window definition in the format "WndClass" or "WndClass;@text=WndCaption", where WndClass is the window's class, and WndCaption is the window's caption.
Both WndClass and WndCaption can include wildcards, * and ?, to match multiple window types based on some common pattern. The asterisk (*) matches a string of any length, including an empty string. The question mark (?) matches any single character or no character.
Examples:
Window Type Description
NetUIHWND Objects with the window class "NetUIHWND".
Vfp* Objects whose window class begins with "Vfp".
XTPReport;@text=My Report Objects with the window class "XTPReport" and caption "My Report".
*;@text=My Report Objects with the caption "My Report" and any window class.
*;@text=*Report Objects whose caption ends with "Report".
* All objects. (Not recommended for performance reasons. Consider using specific object types instead.)

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.MSAASettings.GetWindowList
member.summary: Gets a list of window types identified via the MSAA engine.
member.returns:
A list of window types. Each item is in the "WndClass" or "WndClass;@text=WndCaption" format, where WndClass is the window's class, and WndCaption is the window's caption.
WndClass and WndCaption may include wildcards * and ?. The asterisk (*) means a string of any length, including an empty string. The question mark (?) means any single character or no character.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.MSAASettings.RemoveAllWindows
member.summary: Clears the list of window types identified via the MSAA engine.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.MSAASettings.ToString
member.summary: Converts the list of window types identified via the MSAA engine to a string.
member.returns:
A string holding the comma-separated list of window types identified via the MSAA engine. Each item is in the "WndClass" or "WndClass;@text=WndCaption" format, where WndClass is the window's class, and WndCaption is the window's caption.
WndClass and WndCaption may include wildcards * and ?. The asterisk (*) means a string of any length, including an empty string. The question mark (?) means any single character or no character.

member.name: T:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.UIAutomationSettings

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.UIAutomationSettings.AddWindow(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a window class to the list of UI Automation window classes.
member.param: The window class (the WndClass property value). The value can include wildcards: an asterisk (*) corresponds to a string of any lentgh, a question mark (?) corresponds to any single character.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.UIAutomationSettings.RemoveAllWindows
member.summary: Clears the list of window classes identified via the UI Automation engine.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.UIAutomationSettings.GetWindowList
member.summary: Gets a list of window classes identified via the UI Automation engine.
member.returns: A list of window class names.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.UIAutomationSettings.ToString
member.summary: Converts the list of window classes identified via the UI Automation engine to a string.
member.returns: A string holding the comma-separated list of window classes identified via the UI Automation engine.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.TextRecognitionSettings.AddWindow(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a window class to the list of window classes identified via the Text Recognition engine.
member.param: The window class (the WndClass property value). The value can include wildcards: an asterisk (*) corresponds to a string of any lentgh, a question mark (?) corresponds to any single character.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.TextRecognitionSettings.RemoveAllWindows
member.summary: Clears the list of window classes identified via the Text Recognition engine.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.TextRecognitionSettings.GetWindowList
member.summary: Gets a list of window classes identified via the Text Recognition engine.
member.returns: A list of window class names.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.TextRecognitionSettings.ToString
member.summary: Converts the list of window classes identified via the Text Recognition engine to a string.
member.returns: A string holding the comma-separated list of window classes identified via the Text Recognition engine.

member.name: T:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.ProcessFilterSettings
member.summary: Allows you to filter processes whose objects will be identified by TestLeft.

member.name: T:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.ProcessFilterSettings.FilterMode
member.summary: Constants that define how TestLeft handles processes specified by the process filter.

member.name: F:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.ProcessFilterSettings.FilterMode.UseAll
member.summary: Identify objects in all processes.

member.name: F:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.ProcessFilterSettings.FilterMode.UseOnlyProcessesFromList
member.summary: Identify objects only in those processes that are specified in the process filter.

member.name: F:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.ProcessFilterSettings.FilterMode.IgnoreProcessesFromList
member.summary: Identify objects in all processes except for those in the process filter.

member.name: P:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.ProcessFilterSettings.FilteringMode
member.summary: Specifies how TestLeft handles the processes listed in the process filter.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.ProcessFilterSettings.AddProcess(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the name of the process to be processed or ignored.
member.param: The process name without the extension.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.ProcessFilterSettings.RemoveAllProcesses
member.summary: Clears the list of filtered processes.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.ProcessFilterSettings.GetProcessList
member.summary: Gets a list of filtered processes.
member.returns: A list of process names without the extension.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Options.ProcessFilterSettings.ToString
member.summary: Converts the list of filtered processes to a string.
member.returns: A string holding the comma-separated list of filtered processes.

member.name: T:SmartBear.TestLeft.Log
member.summary: Provides access to the test log. To learn more, see Working With TestLeft Test Logs in TestLeft documentation.

member.name: T:SmartBear.TestLeft.Log.Format
member.summary: Constants that are used to specify the supported log formats.

member.name: F:SmartBear.TestLeft.Log.Format.Html
member.summary: A constant that is used to indicate the HTML format.

member.name: F:SmartBear.TestLeft.Log.Format.Mht
member.summary: A constant that is used to indicate the MHT format.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Log.Message(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Posts a new informative message to the test log.
member.param: The message text.
The text to display in the log's Additional Info. It can be plain or HTML-formatted text. In order for TestLeft to recognize the additional text as HTML code, the text must start with a tag.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Log.Error(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Posts a new error message to the test log.
member.param: The message text.
The text to display in the log's Additional Info. It can be plain or HTML-formatted text. In order for TestLeft to recognize the additional text as HTML code, the text must start with a tag.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Log.Warning(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Posts a new warning message to the test log.
member.param: The message text.
The text to display in the log's Additional Info. It can be plain or HTML-formatted text. In order for TestLeft to recognize the additional text as HTML code, the text must start with a tag.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Log.Picture(System.Drawing.Image,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Posts an image to the test log.
member.param: The image.
The message text.
The text to display in the log's Additional Info. It can be plain or HTML-formatted text. In order for TestLeft to recognize the additional text as HTML code, the text must start with a tag.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Log.Screenshot(SmartBear.TestLeft.TestObjects.IVisualObject,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Makes a screenshot and posts it to the test log.
member.param: The whose image should be posted to the log.
The message text.
The text to display in the log's Additional Info. It can be plain or HTML-formatted text. In order for TestLeft to recognize the additional text as HTML code, the text must start with a tag.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Log.OpenFolder(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new folder in the test log and activates it.
member.param: The folder caption.
The text to display in the log's Additional Info. It can be plain or HTML-formatted text. In order for TestLeft to recognize the additional text as HTML code, the text must start with a tag.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Log.CloseFolder
member.summary: Closes the current log folder.

member.name: M:SmartBear.TestLeft.Log.Save(System.String,SmartBear.TestLeft.Log.Format)
member.summary: Saves the current log.
member.param: The location where the log will be saved.
The format to use for the log: HTML (0) or MHT (1).
